Pre-Game Insights: The Atlanta Braves are 74-61 this year and have won four of their last five games.
The Philadelphia Phillies are 79-56 this season and have alternated wins and losses in their last four games.
The Braves' pitching staff has a 3.64 ERA, while the Phillies' pitching staff has a 3.72 ERA.
The Braves' offense has scored 587 runs, while the Phillies' offense has scored 653 runs.
Marcell Ozuna is batting.309 with 37 home runs and 98 RBI’s for the Braves this season.
Bryce Harper is batting.282 with 26 home runs and 76 RBI’s for the Phillies this season.
The projected starting pitcher for Atlanta is Max Fried, with a 3.50 ERA and a 1.20 WHIP.
The projected starting pitcher for Philadelphia is Zack Wheeler, with a 2.74 ERA and a 1.00 WHIP.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Philadelphia has won each of their last 10 games as home favorites against NL East opponents following a home loss.
The Braves have lost eight of their last 10 night games at Citizens Bank Park following a road win.
The Phillies have covered the run line in 11 of their last 12 Saturday night home games against National League opponents.
Six of the last seven games between the Braves and Phillies at Citizens Bank Park have gone OVER the total runs line.
Eight of the Braves' last 10 night games against NL East opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Braves' last eight games as road underdogs against NL East opponents.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Phillies' last six night games at Citizens Bank Park.
